input:
As Chef Roy Hee, a world-renowned chef at a globally renowned restaurant, you are tasked with designing an entire year's menu for 2018. Your menu should be varied and innovative, adhering to the following guidelines:
1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Midsummer Night's Feast' on 01-21 with a special dish: Grilled Salmon.
1.2 Celebrate 'Winter Solstice Feast' on 05-13 with a special dish: Venison Stew.
1.3 Celebrate 'Australia Day BBQ' on 01-26 with a special dish: Lamb Chops.
1.4 Celebrate 'April Fool's Surprise Menu' on 04-01 with a special dish: Mystery Dish.
1.5 Celebrate 'Restaurant's 10th Anniversary' on 09-19 with a special dish: Champagne and Caviar.
2) Feature 'Game Meat Fortnight' from Week 26 to Week 28 with dishes like: Venison Steaks.
3) Include 'Burger Mondays' every 4 weeks starting from Week 12, serving: Gourmet Burgers.
4) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly menu (e.g. #*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)
Generate a comprehensive weekly menu diary for the entire year of 2018, start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week.
- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.
- Conclude the diary with '*** finished' to signify the completion of the year's menu planning.
- Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the menu throughout the year. *** started ***
#*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):

checks_once.3: Midsummer Night's Feast featuring Grilled Salmon
checks_once.19: Winter Solstice Feast featuring Venison Stew
checks_once.4: Australia Day BBQ featuring Lamb Chops
checks_once.13: April Fool's Surprise Menu featuring Mystery Dish
checks_once.38: Restaurant's 10th Anniversary featuring Champagne and Caviar

checks_range.26: Game Meat Fortnight featuring Venison Steaks
checks_range.27: Game Meat Fortnight featuring Venison Steaks
checks_range.28: Game Meat Fortnight featuring Venison Steaks

output_blocks:
Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 
1. Appetizers: 
   1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 
   1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 
2. Main Courses 
   2.1) Lobster Thermidor Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 
   2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 
3. Side Dishes 
   3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 
   3.2) Glazed Carrots Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 
4. Desserts 
   4.1) Chocolate Mousse A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 
   4.2) Tiramisu Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 
5. Drinks 
   5.1) Fine Wines A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 
   5.2) Champagne Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings.

 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th): 
We We continue our celebration with a focus on fresh seafood and comforting classics. 
1. Appetizers 
   1.1) Crab Cakes Jumbo lump crab meat mixed with herbs and spices, pan-fried to a golden crisp. 
   1.2) Artichoke Hearts Marinated artichoke hearts, drizzled with olive oil and balsamic reduction. 
2. Main Courses 
   2.1) Pan-Seared Scallops Scallops seareded to a perfect golden brown, served with a light lemon butter sauce. 
   2.2) Beef Bourguignon Slow-cooked beef stew with red wine, onions, and mushrooms, served over creamy polenta. 
3. Side Dishes 
   3.1) Roasted Brussels Sprouts Brussels sprouts roasted until crispy, tossed with garlic and thyme. 
   3.2) Truffle Fries Crispy fries tossed with truffle oil and grated parmesan. 
4. Desserts 
   4.1) Raspberry Sorbet Light and refreshing raspberry sorbet to cleanse the palate. 
   4.2) Panna Cotta Vanilla panna cotta with a hint of lemon, served with a berry coulis. 
5. Drinks 
   5.1) Red Wine Selection of robust red wines to pair with the hearty main courses. 
   5.2) Sparkling Water With a twist of lemon or lime for a refreshing alternative.

 Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st): 
0 For Midsummer Night's's Feast, we feature grilled salmon as a centerpiece. 
1. Appetizers 
   1.1) Smoked Salmon Tartare Fresh smoked salmon mixed with capers, dilll, and a touch of horserian. 
   1.2) Shrimp Cocktail Shrimp served in a tangy cocktail sauce, garnished with celery sticks and lemon wedges. 
2. Main Courses 
   2.1) Grilled Salmon Salmon fillets seasoned with sea salt and pepper, grilled to perfection and served with a dill sauce. 
   2.2) Mushroom Risotto Creamy risotto made with Arborio rice and a variety of wild mushrooms, finished with a sprinkle of Parmesan. 
3. Side Dishes 
   3.1) Roasted Asparagus Asparagus spears roasted until tender, drizzled with olive oil and sprinkled with toasted pine nuts. 
   3.2) Grilled Zucchini Zucchini slices grilled until charred and served with a herbed yogurt sauce. 
4. Desserts 
   4.1) Lemon Tart A light and zesty lemon tart with a buttery crust. 
   4.2) Poached Pears Pears po po in a sweet and sp, caramelized with a hint of cinnamon. 
5. Drinks 
   5.1) White Wine Selection of crisp white wines to complement the fresh flavors. 
   5.2) Sparkling Water With a splash of grapefruit juice for a zesty finish.

 Menu Week 4 (January 22nd - January 28th): 
1. Appetizers 
   1.1) Foie Gras Terrine Silky foie gras terrine served with a fig compote and toasted brioche. 
   1.2) Oyster Rockefeller Oysters topped with a rich mixture of spinach, shallots, and breadcrumbs, baked until golden. 
2. Main Courses 
   2.1) Rack of Lamb Lamb chops seasoned with rosemary and garlic, roasted to medium-rare and served with a mint jelly. 
   2.2) Braised Short Ribs Short ribs slow-cooked in red wine and beef broth, served with a creamy red wine sauce. 
3. Side Dishes 
   3.1) Roasted Root Vegetables A medley of root vegetables roasted until tender and sweet, seasoned with thyme and rosemary. 
   3.2) Grilled Cornish Hens Cornish hens grilled to perfection, served with a herbed butter. 
4. Desserts 
   4.1) Chocolate Lava Cake Molten chocolate cake with a gooey center, served with a scoop of vanilla bean ice cream. 
   4.2) Crème Brûlée Rich crème brûlée with a caramelized sugar top, served with a dusting of cinnamon. 
5. Drinks 
   5.1) Red Wine Selection of full-bodied red wines to pair with the rich main courses. 
   5.2) Sparkling Water With a slice of lemon for a refreshing touch.

 Menu Week 5 (January 29th - February 4th): 
1. Appetizers 
   1.1) Seared Scallops Scallops seared to a golden brown, served with a light lemon butter sauce and a side of microgreens. 
   1.2) Grilled Octopus Tentacles of octopus grilled until tender, served with a spicy harissa aioli. 
2. Main Courses 
   2.1) Pan-Seared Chicken Breast Chicken breasts pan-seared to perfection, served with a herbed jus and a side of roasted fingerling potatoes. 
   2.2) Grilled T-bone Steak T-bbone steak grilled to your desired doneness, served with a red wine reduction and a side of sautéed spinach. 
3. Side Dishes 
   3.1) Grilled Asparagus Asparagus spears grilled until charred, served with a lemon vinaigrette. 
   3.2) Roasted Cauliflower Cauliflower roasted until crispy, tossed with garlic and thyme. 
4. Desserts 
   4.1) Raspberry Sorbet Light and refreshing raspberry sorbet to cleanse the palate. 
   4.2) Chocolate Fondue A warm chocolate fondue with a variety of fruits and marshmallows for dipping. 
5. Drinks 
   5.1) Red Wine Selection of robust red wines to pair with the hearty main courses. 
   5.2) Sparkling Water With a twist of orange for a citrusy finish.

 Menu Week 6 (February 5th - February 11th): 
1. Appetizers

2. Main Courses

 Menu Week 7 (February 12th - February 18th): 
1. Appetizers 
   1.1) Smoked Salmon Tartare Fresh smoked salmon mixed with capers, d, and a touch of horseradish.

input:
As Chef Roy Hee, a world-renowned chef at a globally renowned restaurant, you are tasked with designing an entire year's menu for 2018. Your menu should be varied and innovative, adhering to the following guidelines:
1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Father's Day Feast' on 06-17 with a special dish: Barbecued Ribs.
1.2 Celebrate 'Saint Patrick's Day' on 03-17 with a special dish: Irish Stew.
1.3 Celebrate 'Midsummer Night's Feast' on 02-02 with a special dish: Grilled Salmon.
1.4 Celebrate 'Veganuary Special' on 05-11 with a special dish: Vegan Mushroom Risotto.
1.5 Celebrate 'Australia Day BBQ' on 01-26 with a special dish: Lamb Chops.
2) Feature 'Seafood Season Extravaganza' from Week 32 to Week 35 with dishes like: Fresh Seafood Platter.
3) Include 'Burger Mondays' every 4 weeks starting from Week 21, serving: Gourmet Burgers.
4) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly menu (e.g. #*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)
Generate a comprehensive weekly menu diary for the entire year of 2018, start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week.
- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.
- Conclude the diary with '*** finished' to signify the completion of the year's menu planning.
- Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the menu throughout the year. *** started ***
#*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):

output_blocks:
Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 
1. Appetizers: 
   1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 
   1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 
2. Main Courses 
   2.1) Lobster Thermidor Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 
   2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 
3. Side Dishes 
   3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 
   3.2) Glazed Carrots Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 
4. Desserts 
   4.1) Chocolate Mousse Rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 
   4.2) Tiramisu Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 
5. Drinks 
   5.1) Fine Wines A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 
   5.2) Champagne Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings.

 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th): 
 We continue our journey into the heart of winter with hearty and comforting dishes. 
1. Appetizers 
   1.1) Smoked Salmon Tartare Freshly smoked salmon mixed with capers, dill, and a touch of lemon juice. 
   1.2) Truffle Frittersa A light, fluffy frittata infused with truffle oil and topped with grated Parmesan. 
2. Main Courses 
   2.1) Beef Wellington A tender fillet of beef wrapped in puff pastry, served with a red wine reduction. 
   2.2) Braised Short Ribs Slow-cooked short ribs with a savory red wine sauce. 
3. Side Dishes 
   3.1) Roasted Brussels Sprouts Brussels sprouts roasted with garlic and thyme. 
   3.2) Creamed Spinach Creamy, velvety spinach with a hint of nutmeg. 
4. Desserts 
   4.1) Apple Crumble Warm apple crumble with a crunchy oat topping. 
   4.2) Panna Cotta Vanilla panna cotta with a raspberry coulis. 
5. Drinks 
   5.1) Red Wines A selection of robust reds to pair with the rich main courses. 
   5.2) Hot Chocolate A decadent hot chocolate with a sprinkle of cinnamon.

 Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st): 
 As we move into the third week, we introduce lighter fare with fresh and vibrant flavors. 
1. Appetizers 
   1.1) Avocado Deviled Eggs Creamy avocado mixed with deviled egg yolk and a touch of lime. 
   1.2) Caprese Skewers Cherry tomatoes, fresh mozzarella, and basil skewered and grilled. 
2. Main Courses 
   2.1) Pan-Seareded Cod with Lemon Butter A delicate cod fillet seareded to perfection, served with a zesty lemon butter sauce. 
   2.2) Grilled Chicken Breast with Chimichuria A succulent chicken breast marinated in chimichuria sauce, grilled to juicy perfection.

input:
As Chef Roy Hee, a world-renowned chef at a globally renowned restaurant, you are tasked with designing an entire year's menu for 2018. Your menu should be varied and innovative, adhering to the following guidelines:
1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Midsummer Night's Feast' on 03-28 with a special dish: Grilled Salmon.
1.2 Celebrate 'Valentine's Day Special' on 02-14 with a special dish: Heart-Shaped Red Velvet Cake.
1.3 Celebrate 'Easter Brunch' on 04-01 with a special dish: Spring Lamb Roast.
1.4 Celebrate 'Summer Solstice Celebration' on 12-09 with a special dish: Midsummer Night's Fish Fry.
1.5 Celebrate 'Pancake Day Treat' on 02-13 with a special dish: Blueberry Pancakes.
2) Feature 'Winter Delicacies' from Week 17 to Week 18 with dishes like: Braised Game Meats.
3) Include 'Soup and Salad Midweek' every 2 weeks starting from Week 2, serving: Seasonal Soup and Salad.
4) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly menu (e.g. #*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 
1. Appetizers: 
   1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 
   1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 
2. Main Courses 
   2.1) Lobster Thermidor Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 
   2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 
3. Side Dishes 
   3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 
   3.2) Glazed Carrots Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 
4. Desserts 
   4.1) Chocolate Mousse A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 
   4.2) Tiramisu Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 
5. Drinks 
   5.1) Fine Wines A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 
   5.2) Champagne Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings.

 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th): 
We This week, we introduce a light yet satisfying midweek meal with seasonal soup and salad. 
1. Appetizers 
   1.1) Smoked Salmon Tartare Freshly chopped smoked salmon mixed with capers, dill, and a touch of lemon juice. 
   1.2) Artichoke Hearts Salad Artichoke hearts tossed with baby arugula, lemon vinaigrette, and toasted pine nuts. 
2. Main Courses 
   2.1) Pan-Seared Chicken Breast Chicken breast seareded to a golden brown, served with a side of roasted asparagus. 
   2.2) Beef Bourguignon Slow-cooked beef braised in red wine, served with a rich, creamy sauce. 
3. Side Dishes 
   3.1) Roasted Root Vegetables A medley of root vegetables roasted to perfection, seasoned with thyme and rosemary. 
   3.2) Garlic Bread Crusty bread slices brushed with garlic butter and baked until golden. 
4. Soups and Salads 
   4.1) Butternut Squash Soup Creamy butternut squash soup with a hint of cinnamon and nutmeg. 
   4.2) Mixed Greens Salad Mixed greens dressed with a light vinaigrette and topped with sliced apples and walnuts. 
5. Desserts 
   4.1) Lemon Sorbet Refreshing lemon sorbet to cleanse the palate. 
   4.2) Raspberry Tart Tart filled with fresh raspberries and a crumbly shortcrust crust. 
6. Drinks 
   5.1) White Wine Selection of crisp white wines to pair with the lighter dishes. 
   5.2) Sparkling Water With a twist of lemon or lime for a refreshing option.

 Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st): 
1. Appetizers 
   1.1) Crab Cakes Jumbo lump crab meat mixed with herbs and spices, pancted into a pourdouf base. 
   1.2) Grilled Octopus Tentacles marinated in olive oil, lemon, and garlic, grilled to perfection. 
2. Main Courses 
   2.1) Herb-Crusted Rack of Lamb Lamb chops coated in a herbed crust, roasted to medium-rare. 
   2.2) Pan-Seareded Sea Bass Sea bass fillets seareded to a golden brown, served with a lemon butter sauce. 
3. Side Dishes 
   3.1) Roasted Brussels Sprouts Brussels sprouts roasted until crispy, seasoned with balsamic vinegar and honey. 
   3.2) Wild Rice Pilaf A flavorful pilaf made with wild rice, carrots, and onions. 
4. Soups and Salads 
   4.1) Tomato Basil Soup Rich tomato basil soup with a hint of cream. 
   4.2) Arugula Salad Arugula tossed with cherry tomatoes, cucumber, and a tangy lemon dressing. 
5. Desserts 
   4.1) Panna Cotta Vanilla panna cotta with a drizzle of caramel sauce. 
   4.2) Chocolate Truffle Cake Dark chocolate cake with a smooth truffle filling. 
6. Drinks 
   5.1) Red Wine Selection of full-bodied red wines to complement the hearty main courses. 
   5.2) Sparkling Rosé For a lighter touch, a sparkling rosé is offered.

As Chef Roy Hee, a world-renowned chef at a globally renowned restaurant, you are tasked with designing an entire year's menu for 2018. Your menu should be varied and innovative, adhering to the following guidelines:
1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Christmas Gala Dinner' on 12-25 with a special dish: Roasted Goose.
1.2 Celebrate 'Saint Patrick's Day' on 03-17 with a special dish: Irish Stew.
1.3 Celebrate 'random of Year Party' on 11-06 with a special dish: Gourmet Cheese Platter.
1.4 Celebrate 'Father's Day Feast' on 06-17 with a special dish: Barbecued Ribs.
1.5 Celebrate 'Summer Solstice Celebration' on 08-31 with a special dish: Midsummer Night's Fish Fry.
2) Feature 'Squash and Pumpkin Delights' from Week 5 to Week 5 with dishes like: Pumpkin Pie.
3) Include 'Burger Mondays' every 4 weeks starting from Week 9, serving: Gourmet Burgers.
4) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly menu (e.g. #*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)
Generate a comprehensive weekly menu diary for the entire year of 2018, start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week.
- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.
- Conclude the diary with '*** finished' to signify the completion of the year's menu planning.
- Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the menu throughout the year. *** started ***

input:
As Chef Roy Hee, a world-renowned chef at a globally renowned restaurant, you are tasked with designing an entire year's menu for 2018. Your menu should be varied and innovative, adhering to the following guidelines:
1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Christmas Gala Dinner' on 12-25 with a special dish: Roasted Goose.
1.2 Celebrate 'Memorial Day BBQ' on 09-03 with a special dish: Smoked Brisket.
1.3 Celebrate 'Mother's Day Meal' on 05-13 with a special dish: Eggs Benedict with Salmon.
1.4 Celebrate 'Bastille Day Party' on 07-14 with a special dish: Coq au Vin.
1.5 Celebrate 'Winter Solstice Feast' on 03-21 with a special dish: Venison Stew.
2) Feature 'Seafood Season Extravaganza' from Week 5 to Week 5 with dishes like: Fresh Seafood Platter.
3) Include 'Pasta Wednesdays' every 5 weeks starting from Week 18, serving: Spaghetti Carbonara.
4) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly menu (e.g. #*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)
Generate a comprehensive weekly menu diary for the entire year of 2018, start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week.
- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.
- Conclude the diary with '*** finished' to signify the completion of the year's menu planning.
- Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the menu throughout the year. *** started ***
#*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):

checks_once.52: Christmas Gala Dinner featuring Roasted Goose
checks_once.36: Memorial Day BBQ featuring Smoked Brisket
checks_once.19: Mother's Day Meal featuring Eggs Benedict with Salmon
checks_once.28: Bastille Day Party featuring Coq au Vin
checks_once.12: Winter Solstice Feast featuring Venison Stew

checks_range.5: Seafood Season Extravaganza featuring Fresh Seafood Platter

output_blocks:
Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 
1. Appetizers: 
   1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream.
   1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden.
2. Main Courses 
   2.1) Lobster Thermidor Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell.
   2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce.
3. Side Dishes 
   3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic.
   3.2) Glazed Carrots Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze.
4. Desserts 
   4.1) Chocolate Mousse Rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream.
   4.2) Tiramisu Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese.
5. Drinks 
   5.1) Fine Wines A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals.
   5.2) Champagne Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings.

 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th): 
We We continue our celebration with a focus on fresh and vibrant flavors. 
1. Appetizers 
   1.1) Grilled Octopus Tentacles marinated in olive oil, lemon, and garlic, served with a side of piquillo peppers.
   1.2) Truffle Risotto Creamy risotto infused with black truffles, garnished with microgreens.
2. Main Courses 
   2.1) Pan-Seared Foie Gras Foie gras seareded to perfection, served with a fig compote.
   2.2) Herb-Crusted Rack of Lamb Herbs and spices crusted onto lamb chops, roasted to medium-rare.
3. Side Dishes 
   3.1) Roasted Brussels Sprouts Brussels sprouts roasted with barioli and thyme.
   3.2) Wild Mushroom Risotto A hearty risotto made with a variety of wild mushrooms.
4. Desserts 
   4.1) Raspberry Sorbet Light and refreshing raspberry sorbet to cleanse the palate.
   4.2) Crème Brûlée Rich custard topped with a caramelized sugar crust.
5. Drinks 
   5.1) Rosé Wine A crisp and fruity rosé to pair with the light appetizers.
   5.2) Sparkling Cava Spanish sparkling wine to complement the main courses.

 Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st): 
1. Appetizers 
   1.1) Smoked Salmon Tartare Fresh salmon mixed with capersers, dili, and dill, served with a lemon vinaigrette.
   1.2) Artichoke Hearts Artichokes hearts marinated in olive oil, lemon, and herbs, served with a garlic aioli.
2. Main Courses 
   2.1) Braised Short Ribs Slow-cooked short ribs with a savory red wine reduction.
   2.2) Grilled Chilean Sea Bass Sea bass grilled to perfection, served with a chimichuru sauce.
3. Side Dishes 
   3.1) Roasted Root Vegetables A medley of root vegetables roasted with rosemary and thyme.
   3.2) Green Beans Almondine Green beans sautéed with almonds and butter.
4. Desserts 
   4.1) Lemon Tart A tangy lemon tart with a flaky crust.
   4.2) Panna Cotta Vanilla panna cotta with a hint of lavender.
5. Drinks 
   5.1) Pinot Noir A full-bodied pinot noir to pair with the hearty main courses.
   5.2) Prosecco Italian sparkling wine to finish the meal.

 Menu Week 4 (January 22nd - January 28th): 
1. Appetizers 
   1.1) Shrimp Cocktail Shrimp served in a classic cocktail sauce, garnished with celery sticks.
   1.2) Goat Cheese Crostini Toasted baguette slices topped with goat cheese, honey, and walnuts.
2. Main Courses 
   2.1) Beef Bourguignon Slow-cooked beef stew with red wine and mushrooms.
   2.2) Grilled Chicken Breast Chicken breast grilled to perfection, served with a herbed butter.
3. Side Dishes

   3.2) Creamed Spinachrs Spinachrs cooked in a creamy sauce with garlic and nutmeg.
4. Desserts

5. Drinks

2. Main Courses

   2.2) Pan-Seared Pork Chops Pork chops pan-seared with a sage and onion stuffing.
3. Side Dishes

input:
As Chef Roy Hee, a world-renowned chef at a globally renowned restaurant, you are tasked with designing an entire year's menu for 2018. Your menu should be varied and innovative, adhering to the following guidelines:
1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Cinco de Mayo Fiesta' on 05-05 with a special dish: Tacos Al Pastor.
1.2 Celebrate 'Labor Day BBQ' on 05-01 with a special dish: Grilled Steak.
1.3 Celebrate 'Bastille Day Party' on 07-14 with a special dish: Coq au Vin.
1.4 Celebrate 'Summer Solstice Celebration' on 12-20 with a special dish: Midsummer Night's Fish Fry.
1.5 Celebrate 'Veganuary Special' on 11-30 with a special dish: Vegan Mushroom Risotto.
2) Feature 'Cherry Blossom Festival Dishes' from Week 2 to Week 5 with dishes like: Cherry Blossom Tea and Sweets.
3) Include 'Taco Tuesdays' every 3 weeks starting from Week 21, serving: Assorted Tacos.
4) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly menu (e.g. #*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)
Generate a comprehensive weekly menu diary for the entire year of 2018, start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week.
- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.
- Conclude the diary with '*** finished' to signify the completion of the year's menu planning.
- Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the menu throughout the year. *** started ***
#*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):

checks_once.28: Bastille Day Party featuring Coq au Vin
checks_once.51: Summer Solstice Celebration featuring Midsummer Night's Fish Fry

output_blocks:
Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 
1. Appetizers: 
   1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 
   1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 
2. Main Courses 
   2.1) Lobster Thermidor Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 
   2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 
3. Side Dishes 
   3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 
   3.2) Glazed Carrots Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 
4. Desserts 
   4.1) Chocolate Mousse Rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 
   4.2) Tiramisu Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarponeo cheese. 
5. Drinks 
   5.1) Fine Wines A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 
   5.2) Champagne Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings.

 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th): 
We As we transition into the second week, we introduce a lighter yet equally luxurious menu. 
1. Appetizers 
   1.1) Smoked Salmon Tartare Freshly smoked salmon mixed with capers, dill, and a touch of lemon juice. 
   1.2) Artichoke Hearts Marinated artichoke hearts, drizzled with olive oil and sprinkled with toasted pine nuts. 
2. Main Courses 
   2.1) Pan-Seareded Sea Bass Flawed sea bass seareded to perfection, served with a lemon butter sauce. 
   2.2) Herb-Crusted Rack of Lamb Tender lamb chops encrusted with fresh herbs, roasted to a golden brown. 
3. Side Dishes 
   3.1) Roasted Brussels Sprouts Brussels sprouts roasted with garlic and thyme. 
   3.2) Wild Rice Pilaf A flavorful mix of wild rice, sautéed onions, and mushrooms. 
4. Desserts 
   4.1) Raspberry Sorbet Light and refreshing raspberry sorbet to cleanse the palate. 
   4.2) Crème Brûlée Rich custard topped with a caramelized sugar crust. 
5. Drinks 
   5.1) Rosé Wines A selection of crisp rosé wines to pair with the light main courses. 
   5.2) Sparkling Water With Lemon Slices For those who prefer a non-alcoholic option.

 Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st): 
0 Continuing the theme of elegance and refinement, this week’s menu features a variety of delicate and sophisticated dishes. 
1. Appetizers 
   1.1) Foie Gras Terrine Silky-smooth foie gras terrine, served with a fig compote. 
   1.2) Truffle Macarons Delicate macarons infused with truffle oil, dusted with cocoa powder. 
2. Main Courses 
   2.1) Braised Short Ribs Slow-cooked short ribs, falling apart tender, served with a red wine reduction. 
   2.2) Grilled Octopus Tentacles Grilled octopus tentacles marinated in olive oil, lemon, and garlic. 
3. Side Dishes 
   3.1) Roasted Root Vegetables A medley of roasted root vegetables, including carrots, parsnips, and turnips. 
   3.2) Quinoa Salad A vibrant salad with quinoa, cherry tomatoes, cucumbers, and feta cheese. 
4. Desserts 
   4.1) Panna Cotta Creamy panna cotta with a hint of vanilla, served with a berry coulis. 
   4.2) Chocolate Ganache Cake A rich chocolate cake with a ganache frosting. 
5. Drinks 
   5.1) Red Wines A selection of full-bodied red wines to complement the hearty main courses. 
   5.2) Sparkling Wine For a toast to the new year.

 Menu Week 4 (January 22nd - January 28th): 
0 This week, we focus on a more international flavor, offering a taste of the Mediterranean. 
1. Appetizers 
   1.1) Tapenade A spread made from olives, capers, and sun-dried tomatoes, served with baguette slices. 
   1.2) Greek Salad A fresh salad with tomatoes, cucumbers, red onions, Kalamata olives, and feta cheese. 
2. Main Courses 
   2.1) Grilled Lamb Chops Marinated in olive oil, lemon, and rosemary, grilled to perfection. 
   2.2) Seafood Paella A vibrant paella packed with shrimp, mussels, clams, and saffron-infused rice. 
3. Side Dishes 
   3.1) Grilled Asparagus Asparagus spears grilled and seasoned with olive oil and lemon zest. 
   3.2) Roasted Bell Peppers Roasted bell peppers stuffed with a mixture of rice, herbs, and feta cheese. 
4. Desserts 
   4.1) Bakllavah Layers of phyllo dough, honey-soaked sultanas, and cinnamon, drizzled with syrup. 
   4.2) Turkish Delight A traditional Turkish dessert made with rose water and cornstarch. 
5. Drinks 
   5.1) White Wines A selection of crisp white wines to pair with the seafood and grilled meats. 
   5.2) Sparkling Lemonade For a refreshing drink.

 Menu Week 5 (January 29th - February 4th): 
  This week, we celebrate the arrival of spring with a menu that highlights fresh, seasonal ingredients. 
1. Appetizers 
   1.1) Spring Vegetable Crostini Toasted baguette slices topped with a mix of sautéed spring vegetables. 
   1.2) Avocado Deviled Eggs Deviled eggs filled with a creamy avocado mixture, garnished with chives. 
2. Main Courses 
   2.1) Herb-Crusted Chicken Breast Chicken breast stuffed with fresh herbs and roasted to perfection. 
   2.2) Grilled Salmon with Dill Sauce Salmon fillets grilled to medium-rare, served with a dill sauce. 
3. Side Dishes 
   3.1) Roasted Asparagus Asparagus spears roasted with olive oil and lemon juice. 
   3.2) Wild Mushroom Risotto A creamy risotto made with a variety of wild mushrooms. 
4. Desserts 
   4.1) Lemon Sorbet A light and refreshing lemon sorbet to cleanse the palate. 
   4.2) Raspberry Cheesecake A rich cheesecake with a raspberry coulis. 
5. Drinks 
   5.1) Pinot Noir A selection of light and fruity pinot noirs to complement the lighter main courses. 
   5.2) Sparkling Water with Rose Petals For a unique and elegant touch.

 Menu Week 6 (February 5th - February 11th): 
  This week, we explore the flavors of Asia with a menu that combines Eastern and Western influences. 
1. Appetizers 
   1.1) Edamame with Soy Sauce and Sesame Seeds Boiled edamame tossed with soy sauce and sesame seeds. 
   1.2) Thai Basil Chicken Skewers Chicken skewers marinated in a spicy Thai basil sauce, grilled to perfection. 
2. Main Courses 
   2.1) Beef Short Ribs Braised in a sweet and savory sauce, served with steamed b rice. 
   2.2) Pan-Seareded Tofu with Ginger and Scallions Tofu cubes pan-se seareded with ginger and scallions, served over a bed of spinach. 
3. Side Dishes 
   3.1) Steamed Bok Choy Bok choy steamed and seasoned with garlic and soy sauce. 
   3.2) Fried Rice A colorful fried rice with a mix of vegetables, chicken, and scrambled eggs. 
4. Desserts 
   4.1) Mango Sticky Rice Sweet sticky rice served with fresh mango and coconut milk. 
   4.2) Green Tea Ice Cream A smooth and creamy green tea ice cream. 
5. Drinks 
   5.1) Asian Wines A selection of light and aromatic Asian wines to complement the dishes. 
   5.2) Sparkling Water with Lime For a zesty and refreshing drink.

 Menu Week 7 (February 12th - February 18th): 
  This week, we focus on a menu that celebrates the flavors of the Pacific Rim, blending Japanese and Korean cuisines. 
1. Appetizers 
   1.1) Tempura Shrimp Shrimp battered and deep-fried to a crispy golden brown. 
   1.2) Kimchi Fried Rice A spicy and savory fried rice with kimchi, eggs, and scallions. 
2. Main Courses 
   2.1) Teriyaki Chicken Breasts Chicken breasts marinated in teriyaki sauce, grilled to perfection. 
   2.2) Korean BBQ Short Ribs Short ribs marinated in a spicy gochujang sauce, grilled to perfection. 
3. Side Dishes 
   3.1) Pickled Radish A tangy and crunchy pickled radish. 
   3.2) Steamed Bamboo Shoots Bamboo shoots steamed and seasoned with soy sauce. 
4. Desserts 
   4.1) Matcha Mousse A rich and velvety matcha mousse. 
   4.2) Black Sesame Ice Cream A smooth and creamy black sesame ice cream. 
5. Drinks 
   5.1) Japanese Wines A selection of light and fruity Japanese wines to complement the dishes. 
   5.2) Sparkling Water with Mint For a refreshing and invigorating drink.

 Menu Week 8 (February 19th - February 25th): 
  This week, we offer a menu that highlights the rich and diverse flavors of the Middle East. 
1. Appetizers 
   1.1) Hummus with Pita Bread A creamy hummus served with warm pita bread. 
   1.2) Falafel with Tahini Sauce Deep-fried falafel served with a tahini sauce. 
2. Main Courses 
   2.1) Grilled Lamb Kebabs Lamb kebabs grilled to perfection, served with a mint yogurt sauce. 
   2.2) Chicken Shawarma Chicken shawarma served with a psumac yogurt sauce. 
3. Side Dishes 
   3.1) Roasted Eggplant Eggplant roasted with olive oil and garlic. 
   3.2) Tabouli A fresh tabouli salad with parsley, tomatoes, and bulgurur. 
4. Desserts 
   4.1) Baklava Layers of phyllo dough, honey-soaked walnuts, and cinnamon, drizzled with syrup. 
   4.2) Halva A dense and sweet semolina-based confection. 
5. Drinks 
   5.1) Lebanese Wines A selection of light and fruity Lebanese wines to complement the dishes. 
   5.2) Sparkling Water with Rose Petals For a unique and elegant touch.

 Menu Week 9 (March 1st - March 7th): 
  This week, we celebrate the flavors of Italy with a menu that showcases classic Italian cuisine.

input:
As Chef Roy Hee, a world-renowned chef at a globally renowned restaurant, you are tasked with designing an entire year's menu for 2018. Your menu should be varied and innovative, adhering to the following guidelines:
1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Independence Day Celebration' on 07-04 with a special dish: American Apple Pie.
1.2 Celebrate 'Father's Day Feast' on 06-17 with a special dish: Barbecued Ribs.
1.3 Celebrate 'Winter Solstice Feast' on 02-07 with a special dish: Venison Stew.
1.4 Celebrate 'Oktoberfest Beer Dinner' on 10-06 with a special dish: Sausages and Sauerkraut.
1.5 Celebrate 'Valentine's Day Special' on 02-14 with a special dish: Heart-Shaped Red Velvet Cake.
2) Feature 'Cherry Blossom Festival Dishes' from Week 7 to Week 9 with dishes like: Cherry Blossom Tea and Sweets.
3) Include 'Soup and Salad Midweek' every 2 weeks starting from Week 2, serving: Seasonal Soup and Salad.
4) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly menu (e.g. #*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)
Generate a comprehensive weekly menu diary for the entire year of 2018, start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week.
- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.
- Conclude the diary with '*** finished' to signify the completion of the year's menu planning.
- Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the menu throughout the year. *** started ***
#*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):

output_blocks:
Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 
1. Appetizers: 
   1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 
   1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 
2. Main Courses 
   2.1) Lobster Thermidor Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 
   2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 
3. Side Dishes 
   3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 
   3.2) Glazed Carrots Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 
4. Desserts 
   4.1) Chocolate Mousse A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 
   4.2) Tiramisu Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 
5. Drinks 
   5.1) Fine Wines A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 
   5.2) Champagne Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings.

 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th): 
 We continue our journey into a week of luxurious comfort with a focus on seasonal ingredients. 
1. Appetizers 
   1.1) Truffle Risotto Creamy risotto infused with truffles, garnished with fresh herbs. 
   1.2) Grilled Asparagus with Lemon Butter Asparagus spears grilled to perfection, drizzled with a zesty lemon butter. 
2. Main Courses 
   2.1) Pan-Seareded Sea Bass Sea bass fillets seareded to a golden brown, served with a light lemon butter sauce. 
   2.2) Beef Wellington Beef tenderloin wrapped in puff pastry, served with a red wine reduction. 
3. Side Dishes 
   3.1) Roasted Brussels Sprouts Brussels sprouts roasted until crispy, tossed with balsamic glaze. 
   3.2) Wild Mushroom Risotto Rich and creamy risotto made with a variety of wild mushrooms. 
4. Desserts 
   4.1) Raspberry Sorbet Light and refreshing raspberry sorbet to cleanse the palate. 
   4.2) Crème Brûlée Classic French custard dessert with a caramelized sugar crust. 
5. Drinks 
   5.1) Pinot Noir A smooth and fruity red wine to pair with the main courses. 
   5.2) Sparkling Cider A crisp and refreshing cider to complement the lighter dishes.

 Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st): 
 This week, we explore the flavors of the Pacific Northwest with a focus on fresh seafood and hearty winter fare. 
1. Appetizers 
   1.1) Smoked Salmon Tartare Fresh salmon mixed with capers, dilll, and a touch of horser d cream. 
   1.2) Oyster Rockefeller Oysters topped with a rich spinach and mushroom filling, baked until bubbly. 
2. Main Courses 
   2.1) Pan-Seareded Halibut Halibut fillets seareded to a perfect golden brown, served with a lemon dillll sauce. 
   2.2) Venison Chops Venison chops marinated in a blend of herbs and spices, grilled to perfection. 
3. Side Dishes 
   3.1) Roasted Root Vegetables A medley of root vegetables roasted until tender and sweet. 
   3.2) Creamed Spinach Creamy spinach cooked with garlic and cream. 
4. Desserts 
   4.1) Pecpew Berry Cheesecake A rich cheesecake with a layer of pomegranate jelly. 
   4.2) Warm Apple Crisp A comforting apple crisp with a crunchy oat topping. 
5. Drinks 
   5.1) Cabernet Sauvage A robust red wine to pair with the venison. 
   5.2) Sparkling Prosecco A light and bubbly wine to complement the lighter dishes.

 Menu Week 4 (January 22nd - January 28th): 
 We continue our exploration of the Pacific Northwest with a focus on local produce and artisanal ingredients. 
1. Appetizers 
   1.1) Artisanal Cheese Board A selection of local cheeses paired with house-made crackers and preserves. 
   1.2) Grilled Octopus Tentacles Grilled octopus tentacles seasoned with olive oil, lemon, and garlic. 
2. Main Courses 
   2.1) Grilled Salmon with Avocado Salsa Grilled salmon fillets topped with a vibrant avocado salsa. 
   2.2) Wild Game Stew A hearty stew made with a variety of wild game meats, slow-cooked with root vegetables. 
3. Side Dishes 
   3.1) Roasted Cauliflower Cauliflower roasted until crispy, tossed with a herbed vinaigrette. 
   3.2) Butternut Squash Puree Creamy butternut squash puree with a hint of nutmeg. 
4. Desserts 
   4.1) Chocolate Fondue A warm chocolate fondue with a variety of dipping fruits and pastries. 
   4.2) Pear and Walnut Tart A flaky tart filled with p pears and toasted walnuts. 
5. Drinks 
   5.1) Zinfandel A full-bodied red wine to pair with the game stew. 
   5.2) Sparkling Moscato A sweet and aromatic wine to complement the chocolate fondue.

 Menu Week 5 (January 29th - February 4th): 
 This week, we turn our attention to the flavors of Asia with a focus on bold and aromatic spices. 
1. Appetizers 
   1.1) Thai Basil Chicken Skewers Chicken skewers marinated in a spicy Thai basil sauce, grilled to perfection. 
   1.2) Japanese Miso Soup A comforting bowl of miso soup with tofu and seaweed. 
2. Main Courses 
   2.1) Spicy Curry Beef Beef cubes cooked in a rich and spicy curry sauce. 
   2.2) Steamed Fish with Lemongrass and Ginger Steamed fish with a fragrant lemongrass and ginger broth. 
3. Side Dishes 
   3.1) Stir-Fried Vegetables A colorful mix of stir-fried vegetables with a savory soy sauce. 
   3.2) Rice Noodles with Peanut Sauce Rice noodles tossed in a creamy peanut sauce. 
4. Desserts 
   4.1) Mango Sticky Rice A sweet and sticky dessert made with coconut milk and mango. 
   4.2) Green Tea Ice Cream A refreshing scoop of green tea ice cream. 
5. Drinks 
   5.1) Thai Iced Tea A sweet and spicy iced tea to pair with the spicy curry beef. 
   5.2) Sparkling Sake A light and refreshing sake to complement the steamed fish.

 Menu Week 6 (February 5th - February 11th): 
 We continue our Asian theme with a focus on Japanese cuisine, known with delicate flavors and textures. 
1. Appetizers 
   1.1) Edamame with Soy Sauce Boiled edamame seasoned with a simple yet flavorful soy sauce. 
   1.2) Tempura Shrimp Shrimp battered and fried to a crispy golden brown. 
2. Main Courses 
   1.1) Sushi Platter A selection of fresh sushi rolls and sashimi. 
   1.2) Teriyaki Chicken Chicken marinated in a sweet teriyaki sauce, grilled to perfection. 
3. Side Dishes 
   1.1) Pickled Daikon Radish A tangy and crisp pickled daikon radish. 
   1.2) Gyoza Dumplings Steamed or pan-fried gyoza dumplings filled with pork and vegetables. 
4. Desserts 
   1.1) Green Tea Parfait Layers of green tea ice cream and matcha-flavored sponge cake. 
   1.2) Japanese Black Sesame Pudding A rich and creamy pudding made with black sesame seeds. 
5. Drinks 
   1.1) Japanese Green Tea A delicate and aromatic green tea to pair with the sushi. 
   1.2) Sparkling Sake A light and refreshing sake to complement the teriyaki chicken.

 Menu Week 7 (February 12th - February 18th): 
 We celebrate the Cherry Blossom Festival with a menu inspired by the delicate and beautiful blooms. 
1. Appetizers 
   1.1) Sakura Flower Tea Infused green tea with cherry blossom petals. 
   1.2) Sakura Blossom Scones Light and fluffy scones with a hint of cherry blossom flavor. 
2. Main Courses 
   1.1) Sakura Shrimp Cocktail Shrimp served in a light and refreshing sakura-flavored sauce. 
   1.2) Sakura Glazed Salmon Salmon fillets glazed with a sweet and sour sakura sauce. 
3. Side Dishes 
   1.1) Sakura Rice A delicate rice dish with a subtle sakura flavor. 
   1.2) Sakura Vegetable Medley A colorful medley of vegetables sautéed with sakura-infused oil. 
4. Desserts 
   1.1) Sakura Cheesecake A rich cheesecake with a layer of sakura jelly. 
   1.2) Sakura Ice Cream A light and refreshing ice cream with a sakura flavor. 
5. Drinks 
   1.1) Sakura Green Tea A delicate and aromatic green tea infused with sakura petals. 
   1.2) Sparkling Sakura Sake A light and refreshing sake with a sakura flavor.

 Menu Week 10 (March 5th - March 11th): 
 We transition into spring with a menu that celebrates the arrival of fresh, vibrant flavors. 
1. Appetizers 
   1.1) Spring Vegetable Tart A colorful tart filled with a medley of spring vegetables. 
   1.2) Herb and Goat Cheese Crostini Toasted baguette slices topped with a creamy goat cheese spread and fresh herbs. 
2. Main Courses 
   1.1) Herb-Crusted Rack of Lamb Lamb racks coated in a herbed crust, roasted to perfection. 
   1.2) Grilled Asparagus with Lemon Vinaigrette Asparagus spears grilled to perfection, drizzled with a zesty lemon vinaigrette. 
3. Side Dishes 
   1.1) Roasted Spring Vegetables A medley of roasted spring vegetables, including asparagus, peas, and carrots. 
   1.2) Quinoa Salad A light and refreshing salad made with quinoa, mixed greens, and a lemon-tahini dressing. 
4. Desserts 
   1.1) Lemon Sorbet A light and refreshing lemon sorbet to cleanse the palate. 
   1.2) Lavender Shortbread Cookies A delicate shortbread cookie infused with the floral notes of lavender. 
5. Drinks 
   1.1) Pinot Noir A smooth and fruity red wine to pair with the lamb. 
   1.2) Sparkling Prosecco A light and bubbly wine to complement the lighter dishes.

As Chef Roy Hee, a world-renowned chef at a globally renowned restaurant, you are tasked with designing an entire year's menu for 2018. Your menu should be varied and innovative, adhering to the following guidelines:
1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Christmas Gala Dinner' on 12-25 with a special dish: Roasted Goose.
1.2 Celebrate 'Summer Solstice Celebration' on 12-27 with a special dish: Midsummer Night's Fish Fry.
1.3 Celebrate 'Winter Solstice Feast' on 01-23 with a special dish: Venison Stew.
1.4 Celebrate 'Father's Day Feast' on 06-17 with a special dish: Barbecued Ribs.
1.5 Celebrate 'Thanksgiving Dinner' on 11-22 with a special dish: Roast Turkey with Stuffing.
2) Feature 'Seafood Season Extravaganza' from Week 9 to Week 10 with dishes like: Fresh Seafood Platter.
3) Include 'Dessert Sundays' every 3 weeks starting from Week 7, serving: Chocolate Lava Cake.
4) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly menu (e.g. #*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)
Generate a comprehensive weekly menu diary for the entire year of 2018, start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week.
- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.
- Conclude the diary with '*** finished' to signify the completion of the year's menu planning.
- Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the menu throughout the year. *** started ***

Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 
1. Appetizers: 
   1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 
   1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 
2. Main Courses 
   2.1) Lobster Thermidor Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 
   2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 
3. Side Dishes 
   3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 
   3.2) Glazed Carrots Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 
4. Desserts 
   4.1) Chocolate Mousse Rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 
   4.2) Tiramisu Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 
5. Drinks 
   5.1) Fine Wines A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 
   5.2) Champagne Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings.

 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th): 
 We continue our journey into the heart of winter with hearty and comforting dishes. 
1. Appetizers 
   1.1) Smoked Salmon Tartare Freshly smoked salmon mixed with capers, dill, and a touch of horserow root. 
   1.2) Truffle Frites Crispy fries tossed in truffle oil and sprinkled with grated Parmesan. 
2. Main Courses 
   2.1) Beef Wellington Beef fillet wrapped in puff pastry, served with a red wine reduction. 
   2.2) Pan-Seareded Cod with Lemon Butter A flaky cod fillet seareded to perfection, served with a zesty lemon butter sauce. 
3. Side Dishes 
   3.1) Roasted Brussels Sprouts Brussels sprouts roasted until caramelized, drizzled with balsamic glaze. 
   3.2) Creamed Spinach Creamy, velvety spinach puree with a hint of nutmeg. 
4. Desserts 
   4.1) Raspberry Sorbet Refreshing raspberry sorbet to cleanse the palate. 
   4.2) Panna Cotta Vanilla panna cotta with a berry compote. 
5. Drinks 
   5.1) Red Wine Selection A carefully chosen selection of red wines to pair with the main courses. 
   5.2) Hot Chocolate Decadent hot chocolate with a sprinkle of cinnamon and a dash of nutmeg.

 Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st): 
 This week, we explore the flavors of the Pacific Northwest with fresh and locally sourced ingredients. 
1. Appetizers 
   1.1) Oyster Rockefeller Fresh oysters topped with a rich, creamy spinach and mushroom mixture. 
   1.2) Grilled Octopus Tentacles marinated in olive oil, lemon, and garlic, then grilled to perfection. 
2. Main Courses 
   2.1) Wild Alaskan Salmon Grilled salmon with a dilll of dillll and a side of asparagus. 
   2.2) Mushroom Risotto Creamy risotto made with a variety of wild mushrooms and finished with a sprinkle of truffle oil. 
3. Side Dishes 
   3.1) Roasted Root Vegetables A medley of roasted root vegetables, including carrots, parsnips, and turnips. 
   3.2) Herb-Infused Green Beans Green beans infused with fresh herbs and roasted until tender. 
4. Desserts 
   4.1) Apple Crumble Warm apple crumble with a scoop of vanilla ice cream. 
   4.2) Lavender Shortbread Cookies Crisp shortbread cookies infused with the delicate flavor of lavender. 
5. Drinks 
   5.1) Pinot Noir A selection of Pinot Noirs from the Pacific Northwest. 
   5.2) Mulled Wine Spiced mulled wine to warm up the evening.

 Menu Week 4 (January 22nd - January 28th): 
 We transition into the heart of winter with a focus on warming and comforting dishes. 
1. Appetizers 
   1.1) Smoked Gouda Deviled Eggs Deviled eggs filled with a creamy mixture of smoked gouda, mayonnaise, and mustard. 
   1.2) Grilled Artichokes Artichokes grilled until tender, drizzled with a balsamic reduction. 
2. Main Courses 
   2.1) Braised Short Ribs Slow-cooked short ribs with a rich, savory sauce. 
   2.2) Chicken Pot Pie A classic chicken pot pie with a flaky crust and a creamy filling. 
3. Side Dishes 
   3.1) Roasted Sweet Potatoes Sweet potatoes roasted until crispy, drizzled with honey and cinnamon. 
   3.2) Creamed Corn Creamy corn puree with a hint of butter and cream. 
4. Desserts 
   4.1) Gingerbread Trifle Layers of gingerbread cake, custard, and gingerbread cookies. 
   4.2) Caramel Apple Tart A tart filled with caramelized apples and a layer of crunchy caramel. 
5. Drinks 
   5.1) Red Wine Selection A selection of robust red wines to complement the hearty main courses. 
   5.2) Hot Apple Cider Warm apple cider spiced with cinnamon and nutmeg.

 Menu Week 5 (January 29th - February 4th):

1. Appetizers 
   1.1) Bruschetta with Tomato and Basil Freshly toasted baguette topped with diced tomatoes, basil, and a drizzle of olive oil. 
   1.2) Grilled Halloumi Cheese Grilled halloumi cheese with a side of tzatziki sauce. 
2. Main Courses 
   2.1) Grilled Lamb Chops Lamb chops seasoned with rosemary and grilled to perfection.

3. Side Dishes 
   3.1) Roasted Bell Peppers Bell peppers roasted until soft, stuffed with a mixture of rice, herbs, and feta. 
   3.2) Garlic Mashed Potatoes Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 
4. Desserts

   4.2) Greek Yogurt with Honey and Nuts A bowl of Greek yogurt topped with honey and chopped nuts. 
5. Drinks 
   5.1) Red Wine Selection A selection of red wines from the Mediterranean region. 
   5.2) Sparkling Rosé A refreshing rosé to pair with the seafood paella.

input:
As Chef Roy Hee, a world-renowned chef at a globally renowned restaurant, you are tasked with designing an entire year's menu for 2018. Your menu should be varied and innovative, adhering to the following guidelines:
1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Mid-Autumn Festival' on 09-24 with a special dish: Mooncakes.
1.2 Celebrate 'Cinco de Mayo Fiesta' on 05-05 with a special dish: Tacos Al Pastor.
1.3 Celebrate 'Summer Solstice Celebration' on 04-06 with a special dish: Midsummer Night's Fish Fry.
1.4 Celebrate 'Labor Day BBQ' on 05-01 with a special dish: Grilled Steak.
1.5 Celebrate 'Father's Day Feast' on 06-17 with a special dish: Barbecued Ribs.
2) Feature 'Mushroom Season Specials' from Week 22 to Week 25 with dishes like: Various Mushroom Dishes.
3) Include 'Soup and Salad Midweek' every 2 weeks starting from Week 3, serving: Seasonal Soup and Salad.
4) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly menu (e.g. #*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)
Generate a comprehensive weekly menu diary for the entire year of 2018, start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week.
- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.
- Conclude the diary with '*** finished' to signify the completion of the year's menu planning.
- Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the menu throughout the year. *** started ***

Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 
1. Appetizers: 
   1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 
   1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 
2. Main Courses 
   2.1) Lobster Thermidor Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 
   2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 
3. Side Dishes 
   3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 
   3.2) Glazed Carrots Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 
4. Desserts 
   4.1) Chocolate Mousse A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 
   4.2) Tiramisu Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 
5. Drinks 
   5.1) Fine Wines A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 
   5.2) Champagne Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings.

 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th): 
 We continue our journey into the heart of winter with hearty and comforting dishes. 
1. Appetizers 
   1.1) Smoked Salmon Tartare Freshly smoked salmon mixed with capers, dill, and a touch of horserser. 
   1.2) Truffle Frites Crispy fries drizzled with truffle oil and sprinkled with parmesan. 
2. Main Courses 
   2.1) Beef Wellington Beef fillet wrapped in puff pastry, served with a red wine reduction. 
   2.2) Braised Short Ribs Slow-cooked short ribs with a savory jus. 
3. Side Dishes 
   3.1) Roasted Brussels Sprouts Brussels sprouts roasted with garlic and thyme. 
   3.2) Creamed Spinachls Spinachls cooked in a creamy sauce with a hint of nutmeg. 
4. Desserts 
   4.1) Apple Crumble Warm apple crumble with a scoop of vanilla ice cream. 
   4.2) Panna Cotta Vanilla panna cotta with a raspberry coulis. 
5. Drinks 
   5.1) Red Wines A selection of robust red wines to pair with the rich main courses. 
   5.2) Hot Chocolate Decadent hot chocolate with whipped cream and a sprinkle of cinnamon.

 Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st): 
 We introduce a light and refreshing soup and salad midweek to balance the heavier fare. 
1. Appetizers 
   1.1) Deviled Eggs Spicy deviled eggs with a kick of jalapeño. 
   1.2) Artichoke Hearts Marinated artichoke hearts with a lemon vinaigrette. 
2. Main Courses 
   2.1) Pan-Seared Chicken Breast Chicken breast pan-sefried with herbs and served with a lemon butter sauce. 
   2.2) Grilled Salmon with Avocado Salsa Grilled salmon topped with a fresh avocado salsa. 
3. Side Dishes 
   3.1) Roasted Asparagus Asparagus roasted with olive oil and sea salt. 
   3.2) Quinoa Salad Quinoa salad with cherry tomatoes, cucumbers, and feta cheese. 
4. Desserts 
   4.1) Lemon Bars Lemon bars with a graham cracker crust. 
   4.2) Sorbet Seasonal sorbet to cleanse the palate. 
5. Drinks 
   5.1) White Wines A selection of crisp white wines to complement the lighter dishes. 
   5.2) Iced Tea Iced tea with a twist of lemon and mint.

 Menu Week 4 (January 22nd - January 28th): 
 We explore the flavors of the Pacific Northwest with a focus on seafood and local ingredients. 
1. Appetizers 
   1.1) Oyster Rockefeller Oysters topped with a spinach and ricotta filling, baked until golden. 
   1.2) Crab Cakes Crab cakes made with lump crab meat, served with a remoulade sauce. 
2. Main Courses 
   2.1) Dungeness Crab Legs Dungeness crab legs steamed and served with a drawn butter. 
   2.2) Halibut with Dill Sauce Halibut fillets po-fried with a dill sauce. 
3. Side Dishes

   3.2) Roasted Root Vegetables Root vegetables roasted with rosemary and thyme. 
4. Desserts

5. Drinks 
   5.1) Pinot Noir A selection of pinot noir to pair with the seafood dishes. 
   5.2) Sparkling Water Sparkling water with a slice of lemon.

Design a vibrant and diverse city using a 10x10 block grid, numbered from 1 to 100. Arrange the blocks sequentially from left to right and top to bottom. Ensure that each block is uniquely planned to reflect a wide array of city facilities, highlighting the rich urban environment and cultural diversity.1) Specific block requirements:
  - Designate Block at (4, 9) for university use.
  - Designate Block at (9, 7) for library use.
  - Designate Block at (5, 3) for sports complex use.
  - Designate Block at (0, 5) for museum use.
  - Designate Block at (3, 3) for library use.
2) Range block requirements: Allocate a shopping district along the column from (1, 9) to (4, 9).
3) Periodic block requirements: Include a bus station starting from Block at (0, 5) with an interval of every 2 blocks along the column.
4) Document each block independently with detailed descriptions of the intended facilities, architectural features, and unique design elements.
5) Use '#*#' to separate the documentation for each block like (e.g. #*# Block 1 (0, 0): 
This block is the entry point to the cultural quarter and is dedicated to a contemporary art gallery. The details are as follows: Architecture: The building is designed with expansive glass facades and a minimalist aesthetic, making it a landmark in the cityscape. Its structure allows for maximum natural light, which highlights the artworks inside and creates an inviting atmosphere for visitors. Purpose: The gallery showcases a wide range of artworks from both local and international artists. It serves as a platform for cultural exchange and artistic expression, featuring everything from traditional paintings to modern digital installations. City Value: As a pivotal part of the cultural quarter, this gallery enhances the city's reputation as a center for arts and culture. It attracts tourists and art lovers, providing a significant boost to the local economy. The gallery also offers educational programs and workshops, fostering community engagement and supporting local artists.)
Ensure that the document consists of 100 entries, each containing at least 150 words. Ensure that the document contains detailed descriptions for each block, with a minimum of 150 words per description. Ensure clarity and continuity in the narrative throughout the document without any interruptions or omissions. When all block assignments are complete, use '*** finished' to indicate the end of the document. *** started ***
#*# Block 1 (0, 0):

Design a vibrant and diverse city using a 10x10 block grid, numbered from 1 to 100. Arrange the blocks sequentially from left to right and top to bottom. Ensure that each block is uniquely planned to reflect a wide array of city facilities, highlighting the rich urban environment and cultural diversity.1) Specific block requirements:
  - Designate Block at (1, 7) for hospital use.
  - Designate Block at (7, 2) for library use.
  - Designate Block at (9, 7) for fire station use.
  - Designate Block at (0, 8) for library use.
  - Designate Block at (3, 2) for sports complex use.
2) Range block requirements: Allocate a cultural quarter along the row from (1, 3) to (1, 4).
3) Periodic block requirements: Include a coffee shop starting from Block at (0, 5) with an interval of every 4 blocks along the column.
4) Document each block independently with detailed descriptions of the intended facilities, architectural features, and unique design elements.
5) Use '#*#' to separate the documentation for each block like (e.g. #*# Block 1 (0, 0): 
This block is the entry point to the cultural quarter and is dedicated to a contemporary art gallery. The details are as follows: Architecture: The building is designed with expansive glass facades and a minimalist aesthetic, making it a landmark in the cityscape. Its structure allows for maximum natural light, which highlights the artworks inside and creates an inviting atmosphere for visitors. Purpose: The gallery showcases a wide range of artworks from both local and international artists. It serves as a platform for cultural exchange and artistic expression, featuring everything from traditional paintings to modern digital installations. City Value: As a pivotal part of the cultural quarter, this gallery enhances the city's reputation as a center for arts and culture. It attracts tourists and art lovers, providing a significant boost to the local economy. The gallery also offers educational programs and workshops, fostering community engagement and supporting local artists.)
Ensure that the document consists of 100 entries, each containing at least 150 words. Ensure that the document contains detailed descriptions for each block, with a minimum of 150 words per description. Ensure clarity and continuity in the narrative throughout the document without any interruptions or omissions. When all block assignments are complete, use '*** finished' to indicate the end of the document. *** started ***

Design a vibrant and diverse city using a 10x10 block grid, numbered from 1 to 100. Arrange the blocks sequentially from left to right and top to bottom. Ensure that each block is uniquely planned to reflect a wide array of city facilities, highlighting the rich urban environment and cultural diversity.1) Specific block requirements:
  - Designate Block at (3, 0) for botanical garden use.
  - Designate Block at (7, 5) for library use.
  - Designate Block at (6, 9) for farm use.
  - Designate Block at (1, 6) for industrial sector use.
  - Designate Block at (4, 7) for botanical garden use.
2) Range block requirements: Allocate a shopping district along the row from (7, 2) to (7, 5).
3) Periodic block requirements: Include a coffee shop starting from Block at (0, 5) with an interval of every 4 blocks along the column.
4) Document each block independently with detailed descriptions of the intended facilities, architectural features, and unique design elements.
5) Use '#*#' to separate the documentation for each block like (e.g. #*# Block 1 (0, 0):

Its structure allows for maximum natural light, which highlights the artworks inside and creates an inviting atmosphere for visitors. The gallery also offers educational programs and workshops, fostering community engagement and supporting local artists.)

3) Periodic block requirements: Include a coffee shop starting from Block at (0, 5) with an interval of every 4 blocks along the column.
